intro: Pimelodendron zoanthogyne, commonly known as the golden pimelodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem with smooth, glossy bark and produces small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in some regions.
